column1: '''When winter first begins to bite''' is a brief poem spoken by [[Bilbo Baggins]] to [[Frodo Baggins|Frodo]] in "[[The Ring Goes South]]"
column2: in which he warns Frodo of the dangers of traveling in wintertime.

column1: When winter first begins to bite
and stones crack in the frosty night
when pools are black and trees are bare
'tis evil in the Wild to fare.
* [[Poems in The Lord of the Rings]]
